frameDefinitions: A concept, Concept_1, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, Concept_2 by means of some evidence.
An Entity began its existence in the context of a Origin, which can be a place,  culture, time period, text, etc.
This frame covers the basic uses of direction words like the adverbs east, up, and forward.
These adjectives describe the degree of strictness or tolerance of an Agent, usually with regard to another person (the Controllee) and often with regard to a particular Issue.
An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer.

An Influencing_entity, an Influencing_situation, or an Influencing_variable has an influence on a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation,  or a Dependent_variable.  ''  Compare to Subjective_influence.
frameExamples: The Christian <t>origin</t> of this quote is from Isaiah 22.
Court says judge too <t>lenient</t> in rape case.INI
These works had a profound effect and <t>influenced</t> her in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region.
More and more doctors realise that diet can <t>influence</t> disease.
listRoleDefinitions: The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.  Generally expressed as the external argument.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.  Generally expressed as a PP complement.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
The item whose <fen>Origin</fen> is under discussion.
The place or culture where the <fen>Entity</fen> was produced.
The one-dimensional set of locations.

The Agent is the person who is strict or liberal in his/her control over another. This role is usually the External Argument with predicate adjectives, or the head noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Agent'>The school</fex> is very <t>liberal</t> in approach and curriculum. I attended a very <t>liberal</t> <fex name='Agent'>school</fex>.

The Agent's strictness may be directed towards or limited to some particular person or group over whom he/she has control.  The Controlled_entity generally occurs in a PP Complement.
Grandparents are often <t>indulgent</t> <fex name='Controlled_entity'>with their grandchildren</fex>.
The Agent's strictness may be manifested in particular behavior: The judge was <t>lenient</t> <fex name='Controlling_act'>in dealing with the offender</fex>.

The Agent may be strict or lenient with respect to a particular matter or situation.  Issue occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>: The city council is <t>strict</t> <fex name='Issue'>about pollution control</fex>.

A Medium of control, such as rules, may also be described as strict or lenient.  Medium may occur with or without the Agent who ultimately has control (i.e. the one who implements or enforces the rules). The club has <t>strict</t> <fex name='Medium'>rules</fex> about who can become a member. <fex name='Medium'>Immigration law</fex> is very <t>strict</t>.
The body part or expression of the <fen>Agent</fen> that indicates their strictness.
The person who is influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
A person or thing that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
An Action that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A <fen>Behavior</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.
The <fen>Agent</fen> acts to influence a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Subjective_influencing event occurs.
The location in which one has influence.
A thing or person whose behavior has an effect on an <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by an <fen>Influencing_entity</fen> or an <fen>Influencing_situation</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the influence occurs.
The location at which the influencing occurs.
listRoleExamples: I like to think he quaked under my authoritarian <fex>glare</fex>.
George Gilder would run with this idea later in writing the New Testament of supply-side economics that influenced <fex>Reagan</fex>.
<fex>The balmy temperatures</fex> inspired me to write a poem on the advent of spring.
<fex>The painting</fex> inspired me to take a risk and use the intense green for the sky.
What factors influenced Nixon <fex>to issue the doctrine</fex>?
Attention will also be paid to St. Paul , what influenced him <fex>in his thinking</fex> and what he wrote in his letters about sex, sexuality, men and women
Does anyone know what inspired <fex>this song</fex>?
Chavez has much influence <fex>in South America</fex>.

Much of the acreage in this round is closer to the coastline, and as such has many implications in terms of how <fex>it</fex> could impact upon fish spawning, local bird life, and even the Ministry of Defence in some cases
The Committee is responsible for making recommendations to the Board regarding the group's activities as they impact <fex>on the environment</fex>.
